body: I'm curious as to the motivation for this change. Referenced issue talks about `tf.cond` awkwardness -- things need to be wrapped into a function. But this awkwardness can be fixed on the client level using existing Merge/Switch primitives. IE, a smarter `tf.cond` replacement could instead take existing TensorFlow tensors and ensure laziness by inserting Merge/Switch nodes into the graph like [here](https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/d67410e240369736fc4ba0267250ef27)
